Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:3: The adulterer shall not marry save an adulteress or an idolatress, and the adulteress none shall marry save an adulterer or an idolater.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:4: And those who accuse honourable women but bring not four witnesses, scourge them (with) eighty stripes and never (afterward) accept their testimony - They indeed are evil-doers -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:5: Save those who afterward repent and make amends.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:6: As for those who accuse their wives but have no witnesses except themselves; let the testimony of one of them be four testimonies, (swearing) by Allah that he is of those who speak the truth;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:7: And yet a fifth, invoking the curse of Allah on him if he is of those who lie.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:8: And it shall avert the punishment from her if she bear witness before Allah four times that the thing he saith is indeed false,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:9: And a fifth (time) that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he speaketh truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:10: And had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, and that Allah is Clement, Wise, (ye had been undone).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:11: Lo! they who spread the slander are a gang among you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:12: Why did not the believers, men and women, when ye heard it, think good of their own own folk, and say: It is a manifest untruth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:13: Why did they not produce four witnesses ? Since they produce not witnesses, they verily are liars in the sight of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:14: Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you in the world and the Hereafter an awful doom had overtaken you for that whereof ye murmured.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:15: When ye welcomed it with your tongues, and uttered with your mouths that whereof ye had no knowledge, ye counted it a trifle.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:16: Wherefor, when ye heard it, said ye not: It is not for us to speak of this.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:17: Allah admonisheth you that ye repeat not the like thereof ever, if ye are (in truth) believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:18: And He expoundeth unto you the revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:19: Lo! those who love that slander should be spread concerning those who believe, theirs will be a painful punishment in the world and the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:20: Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, and that Allah is Clement, Merciful, (ye had been undone).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:21: O ye who believe! Follow not the footsteps of the devil.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:22: And let not those who possess dignity and ease among you swear not to give to the near of kin and to the needy, and to fugitives for the cause of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:23: Lo! as for those who traduce virtuous, believing women (who are) careless, cursed are they in the world and the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:24: On the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet testify against them as to what they used to do,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:25: On that day Allah will pay them their just due, and they will know that Allah, He is the Manifest Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:26: Vile women are for vile men, and vile men for vile women.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:27: O ye who believe! Enter not houses other than your own without first announcing your presence and invoking peace upon the folk thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:28: And if ye find no-one therein, still enter not until permission hath been given.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:29: (It is) no sin for you to enter uninhabited houses wherein is comfort for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:30: Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and be modest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:31: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and be modest, and to display of their adornment only that which is apparent, and to draw their veils over their bosoms, and not to reveal their adornment save to their own husbands or fathers or husbands’ fathers, or their sons or their husbands’ sons, or their brothers or their brothers’ sons or sisters’ sons, or their women, or their slaves, or male attendants who lack vigour, or children who know naught of women’s nakedness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:32: And marry such of you as are solitary and the pious of your slaves and maid-servants.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:33: And let those who cannot find a match keep chaste till Allah give them independence by His grace.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:34: And verily We have sent down for you revelations that make plain, and the example of those who passed away before you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:35: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:36: (This lamp is found) in houses which Allah hath allowed to be exalted and that His name shall be remembered therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:37: Men whom neither merchandise nor sale beguileth from remembrance of Allah and constancy in prayer and paying to the poor their due; who fear a day when hearts and eyeballs will be overturned;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:38: That Allah may reward them with the best of what they did, and increase reward for them of His bounty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:39: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are as a mirage in a desert.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:40: Or as darkness on a vast, abysmal sea.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:41: Hast thou not seen that Allah, He it is Whom all who are in the heavens and the earth praise, and the birds in their flight ? Of each He knoweth verily the worship and the praise; and Allah is Aware of what they do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:42: And unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and unto Allah is the journeying.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:43: Hast thou not seen how Allah wafteth the clouds, then gathereth them, then maketh them layers, and thou seest the rain come forth from between them; He sendeth down from the heaven mountains wherein is hail, and smiteth therewith whom He will, and averteth it from whom He will.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:44: Allah causeth the revolution of the day and the night.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:45: Allah hath created every animal of water.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:46: Verily We have sent down revelations and explained them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:47: And they say: We believe in Allah and the messenger, and we obey; then after that a faction of them turn away.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:48: And when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them, lo! a faction of them are averse;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:49: But if right had been with them they would have come unto him willingly.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:50: Is there in their hearts a disease, or have they doubts, or fear they lest Allah and His messenger should wrong them in judgment ? Nay, but such are evil-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:51: The saying of (all true) believers when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them is only that they say: We hear and we obey.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:52: He who obeyeth Allah and His messenger, and feareth Allah, and keepeth duty (unto Him): such indeed are the victorious.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:53: They swear by Allah solemnly that, if thou order them, they will go forth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:54: Say: Obey Allah and obey the messenger.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:55: Allah hath promised such of you as believe and do good work that He will surely make them to succeed (the present rulers) in the earth even as He caused those who were before them to succeed (others); and that He will surely establish for them their religion which He hath approved for them, and will give them in exchange safety after their fear.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:56: Establish worship and pay the poor-due and obey the messenger, that haply ye may find mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:57: Think not that the disbelievers can escape in the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:58: O ye who believe! Let your slaves, and those of you who have not come to puberty, ask leave of you at three times (before they come into your presence): Before the prayer of dawn, and when ye lay aside your raiment for the heat of noon, and after the prayer of night.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:59: And when the children among you come to puberty then let them ask leave even as those before them used to ask it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:60: As for women past child-bearing, who have no hope of marriage, it is no sin for them if they discard their (outer) clothing in such a way as not to show adornment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:61: No blame is there upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor any blame upon the sick nor on yourselves if ye eat from your houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your fathers’ brothers, or the houses of your fathers’ sisters, or the houses of your mothers’ brothers, or the houses of your mothers’ sisters, or (from that) whereof ye hold the keys, or (from the house) of a friend.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:62: They only are the true believers who believe in Allah and His messenger and, when they are with him on some common errand, go not away until they have asked leave of him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:63: Make not the calling of the messenger among you as your calling one of another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 24:64: Lo! verily unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:1: A sura which We have sent down and which We have ordained in it have We sent down Clear Signs, in order that ye may receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:2: The woman and the man guilty of adultery or fornication,- flog each of them with a hundred stripes: Let not compassion move you in their case, in a matter prescribed by God, if ye believe in God and the Last Day: and let a party of the Believers witness their punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:3: Let no man guilty of adultery or fornication marry and but a woman similarly guilty, or an Unbeliever: nor let any but such a man or an Unbeliever marry such a woman: to the Believers such a thing is forbidden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:4: And those who launch a charge against chaste women, and produce not four witnesses (to support their allegations),- flog them with eighty stripes; and reject their evidence ever after: for such men are wicked transgressors;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:5: Unless they repent thereafter and mend (their conduct); for God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:6: And for those who launch a charge against their spouses, and have (in support) no evidence but their own,- their solitary evidence (can be received) if they bear witness four times (with an oath) by God that they are solemnly telling the truth;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:7: And the fifth (oath) (should be) that they solemnly invoke the curse of God on themselves if they tell a lie.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:8: But it would avert the punishment from the wife, if she bears witness four times (with an oath) By God, that (her husband) is telling a lie;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:9: And the fifth (oath) should be that she solemnly invokes the wrath of God on herself if (her accuser) is telling the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:10: If it were not for God’s grace and mercy on you, and that God is Oft-Returning, full of Wisdom,- (Ye would be ruined indeed).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:11: Those who brought forward the lie are a body among yourselves: think it not to be an evil to you; On the contrary it is good for you: to every man among them (will come the punishment) of the sin that he earned, and to him who took on himself the lead among them, will be a penalty grievous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:12: Why did not the believers - men and women - when ye heard of the affair,- put the best construction on it in their own minds and say, "This (charge) is an obvious lie" ?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:13: Why did they not bring four witnesses to prove it? When they have not brought the witnesses, such men, in the sight of God, (stand forth) themselves as liars!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:14: Were it not for the grace and mercy of God on you, in this world and the Hereafter, a grievous penalty would have seized you in that ye rushed glibly into this affair.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:15: Behold, ye received it on your tongues, and said out of your mouths things of which ye had no knowledge; and ye thought it to be a light matter, while it was most serious in the sight of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:16: And why did ye not, when ye heard it, say? - "It is not right of us to speak of this: Glory to God! this is a most serious slander!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:17: God doth admonish you, that ye may never repeat such (conduct), if ye are (true) Believers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:18: And God makes the Signs plain to you: for God is full of knowledge and wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:19: Those who love (to see) scandal published broadcast among the Believers, will have a grievous Penalty in this life and in the Hereafter: God knows, and ye know not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:20: Were it not for the grace and mercy of God on you, and that God is full of kindness and mercy, (ye would be ruined indeed).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:21: O ye who believe! follow not Satan’s footsteps: if any will follow the footsteps of Satan, he will (but) command what is shameful and wrong: and were it not for the grace and mercy of God on you, not one of you would ever have been pure: but God doth purify whom He pleases: and God is One Who hears and knows (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:22: Let not those among you who are endued with grace and amplitude of means resolve by oath against helping their kinsmen, those in want, and those who have left their homes in God’s cause: let them forgive and overlook, do you not wish that God should forgive you? For God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:23: Those who slander chaste women, indiscreet but believing, are cursed in this life and in the Hereafter: for them is a grievous Penalty,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:24: On the Day when their tongues, their hands, and their feet will bear witness against them as to their actions.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:25: On that Day God will pay them back (all) their just dues, and they will realise that God is the (very) Truth, that makes all things manifest.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:26: Women impure are for men impure, and men impure for women impure and women of purity are for men of purity, and men of purity are for women of purity: these are not affected by what people say: for them there is forgiveness, and a provision honourable.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:27: O ye who believe! enter not houses other than your own, until ye have asked permission and saluted those in them: that is best for you, in order that ye may heed (what is seemly).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:28: If ye find no one in the house, enter not until permission is given to you: if ye are asked to go back, go back: that makes for greater purity for yourselves: and God knows well all that ye do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:29: It is no fault on your part to enter houses not used for living in, which serve some (other) use for you: And God has knowledge of what ye reveal and what ye conceal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:30: Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and guard their modesty: that will make for greater purity for them: And God is well acquainted with all that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:31: And say to the believing women that they should lower their gaze and guard their modesty; that they should not display their beauty and ornaments except what (must ordinarily) appear thereof; that they should draw their veils over their bosoms and not display their beauty except to their husbands, their fathers, their husband’s fathers, their sons, their husbands’ sons, their brothers or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their women, or the slaves whom their right hands possess, or male servants free of physical needs, or small children who have no sense of the shame of sex; and that they should not strike their feet in order to draw attention to their hidden ornaments.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:32: Marry those among you who are single, or the virtuous ones among yourselves, male or female: if they are in poverty, God will give them means out of His grace: for God encompasseth all, and he knoweth all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:33: Let those who find not the wherewithal for marriage keep themselves chaste, until God gives them means out of His grace.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:34: We have already sent down to you verses making things clear, an illustration from (the story of) people who passed away before you, and an admonition for those who fear (God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:35: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:36: (Lit is such a Light) in houses, which God hath permitted to be raised to honour; for the celebration, in them, of His name: In them is He glorified in the mornings and in the evenings, (again and again),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:37: By men whom neither traffic nor merchandise can divert from the Remembrance of God, nor from regular Prayer, nor from the practice of regular Charity: Their (only) fear is for the Day when hearts and eyes will be transformed (in a world wholly new),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:38: That God may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and add even more for them out of His Grace: for God doth provide for those whom He will, without measure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:39: But the Unbelievers,- their deeds are like a mirage in sandy deserts, which the man parched with thirst mistakes for water; until when he comes up to it, he finds it to be nothing: But he finds God (ever) with him, and God will pay him his account: and God is swift in taking account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:40: Or (the Unbelievers’ state) is like the depths of darkness in a vast deep ocean, overwhelmed with billow topped by billow, topped by (dark) clouds: depths of darkness, one above another: if a man stretches out his hands, he can hardly see it! for any to whom God giveth not light, there is no light!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:41: Seest thou not that it is God Whose praises all beings in the heavens and on earth do celebrate, and the birds (of the air) with wings outspread? Each one knows its own (mode of) prayer and praise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:42: Yea, to God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; and to God is the final goal (of all).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:43: Seest thou not that God makes the clouds move gently, then joins them together, then makes them into a heap? - then wilt thou see rain issue forth from their midst.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:44: It is God Who alternates the Night and the Day: verily in these things is an instructive example for those who have vision!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:45: And God has created every animal from water: of them there are some that creep on their bellies; some that walk on two legs; and some that walk on four.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:46: We have indeed sent down signs that make things manifest: and God guides whom He wills to a way that is straight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:47: They say, "We believe in God and in the apostle, and we obey": but even after that, some of them turn away: they are not (really) Believers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:48: When they are summoned to God and His apostle, in order that He may judge between them, behold some of them decline (to come).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:49: But if the right is on their side, they come to him with all submission.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:50: Is it that there is a disease in their hearts? or do they doubt, or are they in fear, that God and His Apostle will deal unjustly with them? Nay, it is they themselves who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:51: The answer of the Believers, when summoned to God and His Apostle, in order that He may judge between them, is no other than this: they say, "We hear and we obey": it is such as these that will attain felicity.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:52: It is such as obey God and His Apostle, and fear God and do right, that will win (in the end),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:53: They swear their strongest oaths by God that, if only thou wouldst command them, they would leave (their homes).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:54: Say: "Obey God, and obey the Apostle: but if ye turn away, he is only responsible for the duty placed on him and ye for that placed on you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:55: God has promised, to those among you who believe and work righteous deeds, that He will, of a surety, grant them in the land, inheritance (of power), as He granted it to those before them; that He will establish in authority their religion - the one which He has chosen for them; and that He will change (their state), after the fear in which they (lived), to one of security and peace: ’They will worship Me (alone) and not associate aught with Me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:56: So establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and obey the Apostle; that ye may receive mercy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:57: Never think thou that the Unbelievers are going to frustrate (God’s Plan) on earth: their abode is the Fire,- and it is indeed an evil refuge!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:58: O ye who believe! let those whom your right hands possess, and the (children) among you who have not come of age ask your permission (before they come to your presence), on three occasions: before morning prayer; the while ye doff your clothes for the noonday heat; and after the late-night prayer: these are your three times of undress: outside those times it is not wrong for you or for them to move about attending to each other: Thus does God make clear the Signs to you: for God is full of knowledge and wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:59: But when the children among you come of age, let them (also) ask for permission, as do those senior to them (in age): Thus does God make clear His Signs to you: for God is full of knowledge and wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:60: Such elderly women as are past the prospect of marriage,- there is no blame on them if they lay aside their (outer) garments, provided they make not a wanton display of their beauty: but it is best for them to be modest: and God is One Who sees and knows all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:61: It is no fault in the blind nor in one born lame, nor in one afflicted with illness, nor in yourselves, that ye should eat in your own houses, or those of your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or your sisters, or your father’s brothers or your father’s sisters, or your mohter’s brothers, or your mother’s sisters, or in houses of which the keys are in your possession, or in the house of a sincere friend of yours: there is no blame on you, whether ye eat in company or separately.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:62: Only those are believers, who believe in God and His Apostle: when they are with him on a matter requiring collective action, they do not depart until they have asked for his leave; those who ask for thy leave are those who believe in God and His Apostle; so when they ask for thy leave, for some business of theirs, give leave to those of them whom thou wilt, and ask God for their forgiveness: for God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:63: Deem not the summons of the Apostle among yourselves like the summons of one of you to another: God doth know those of you who slip away under shelter of some excuse: then let those beware who withstand the Apostle’s order, lest some trial befall them, or a grievous penalty be inflicted on them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 24:64: Be quite sure that to God doth belong whatever is in the heavens and on earth.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:1: A sura that We have sent down and appointed; and We have sent down in it signs, clear signs, that haply you will remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:2: The fornicatress and the fornicator -- scourge each one of them a hundred stripes, and in the matter of God’s religion let no tenderness for them seize you if you believe in God and the Last Day; and let a party of the believers witness their chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:3: The fornicator shall marry none but a fornicatress or an idolatress, and the fornicatress -- none shall marry her but a fornicator or an idolator; that is forbidden to the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:4: And those who cast it up on women in wedlock, and then bring not four witnesses, scourge them with eighty stripes, and do not accept any testimony of theirs ever; those -- they are the ungodly,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:5: save such as repent thereafter and make amends; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:6: And those who cast it up on their wives having no witnesses except themselves, the testimony of one of them shall be to testify by God four times that he is of the truthful,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:7: and a fifth time, that the curse of God shall be upon him, if he should be of the liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:8: It shall avert from her the chastisement if she testify by God four times that he is of the liars,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:9: and a fifth time, that the wrath of God shall be upon her, if he should be of the truthful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:10: But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy and that God turns, and is All-wise --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:11: Those who came with the slander are a band of you; do not reckon it evil for you; rather it is good for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:12: Why, when you heard it, did the believing men and women not of their own account think good thoughts, and say, ’This is a manifest calumny’?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:13: Why did they not bring four witnesses against it? But since they did not bring the witnesses, in God’s sight they are the liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:14: But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy in the present world and the world to come there would have visited you for your mutterings a mighty chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:15: When you received it on your tongues, and were speaking with your mouths that whereof you had no knowledge, and reckoned it a light thing, and with God it was a mighty thing --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:16: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, ’It is not for us to speak about this; glory be to Thee! This is a mighty calumny’?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:17: God admonishes you, that you shall never repeat the like of it again; if you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:18: God makes clear to you the signs; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:19: Those who love that indecency should be spread abroad concerning them that believe -- there awaits them a painful chastisement in the present world and the world to come; and God knows, and you know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:20: But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy and that God is All-gentle, All-compassionate --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:21: O believers, follow not the steps of Satan; for whosoever follows the steps of Satan, assuredly he bids to indecency and dishonour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:22: Let not those of you who possess bounty and plenty swear off giving kinsmen and the poor and those who emigrate in the way of God; but let them pardon and forgive.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:23: Surely those who cast it up on women in wedlock that are heedless but believing shall be accursed in the present world and the world to come; and there awaits them a mighty chastisement
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:24: on the day when their tongues, their hands and their feet shall testify against them touching that they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:25: Upon that day God will pay them in full their just due, and they shall know that God is the manifest Truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:26: Corrupt women for corrupt men, and corrupt men for corrupt women; good women for good men, and good men for good women -- these are declared quit of what they say; theirs shall be forgiveness and generous provision.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:27: O believers, do not enter houses other than your houses until you first ask leave and, salute the people thereof; that is better for you; haply you will remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:28: And if you find not anyone therein, enter it not until leave is given to you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:29: There is no fault in you that you enter houses uninhabited wherein enjoyment is for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:30: Say to the believers, that they cast down their eyes and guard their private parts; that is purer for them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:31: And say to the believing women, that they cast down their eyes’ and guard their private parts, and reveal not their adornment save such as is outward; and let them cast their veils over their bosoms, and not reveal their adornment save to their husbands, or their fathers, or their husbands’ fathers, or their sons, or their husbands’ sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their women, or what their right hands own, or such men as attend them, not having sexual desire, or children who have not yet attained knowledge of women’s private parts; nor let them stamp their feet, so that their hidden ornament may be known.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:32: Marry the spouseless among you, and your slaves and handmaidens that are righteous; if they are poor, God will enrich them of His bounty; God is All-embracing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:33: And let those who find not the means to marry be abstinent till God enriches them of His bounty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:34: Now We have sent down to you signs making all clear, and an example of those who passed away before you, and an admonition for the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:35: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth; the likeness of His Light is as a niche wherein is a lamp (the lamp in a glass, the glass as it were a glittering star) kindled from a Blessed Tree, an olive that is neither of the East nor of the West whose oil wellnigh would shine, even if no fire touched it; Light upon Light; (God guides to His Light whom He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:36: in temples God has allowed to be raised up, and His Name to be commemorated therein; therein glorifying Him, in the mornings and the evenings,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:37: are men whom neither commerce nor trafficking diverts from the remembrance of God and to perform the prayer, and to pay the alms, fearing a day when hearts and eyes shall be turned about,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:38: That God may recompense them for their fairest works and give them increase of His bounty; and God provides whomsoever He will, without reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:39: And as for the unbelievers, their works are as a mirage in a spacious plain which the man athirst supposes to be water, till, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing; there indeed he finds God, and He pays him his account in full; (and God is swift at the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:40: or they are as shadows upon a sea obscure covered by a billow above which is a billow above which are clouds, shadows piled one upon another; when he puts forth his hand, wellnigh he cannot see it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:41: Hast thou not seen how that whatsoever is in the heavens and in the earth extols God, and the birds spreading their wings? Each -- He knows its prayer and its extolling; and God knows the things they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:42: To God belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to Him is the homecoming.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:43: ’hast thou not seen how God drives the clouds, then composes them, then converts them into a mass, then thou seest the rain issuing out of the midst of them? And He sends down out of heaven mountains, wherein is hail, so that He smites whom He will with it, and turns it aside from whom He will; wellnigh the gleam of His lightning snatches away the sight.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:44: God turns about the day and the night; surely in that is a lesson for those who have eyes.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:45: God has created every beast of water, and some of them go upon their bellies, and some of them go upon two feet, and some of them go upon four; God creates whatever He will; God is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:46: Now We have sent down signs making all clear; God guides whomsoever He will to a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:47: They say, ’We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:48: When they are called to God and His Messenger that he may judge between them, lo, a party of them are swerving aside;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:49: but if they are in the right, they will come to him submissively.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:50: What, is there sickness in their hearts, or are they in doubt, or do they fear that God may be unjust towards them and His Messenger? Nay, but those -- they are the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:51: All that the believers say, when they are called to God and His Messenger, that he may judge between them, is that they say, ’We hear, and we obey’; those -- they are the prosperers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:52: Whoso obeys God and His Messenger, and fears God and has awe of Him, those -- they are the triumphant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:53: They have sworn by God the most earnest oaths, if thou commandest them they will go forth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:54: Say: ’Obey God, and obey the Messenger; then, if you turn away, only upon him rests what is laid on him, and upon you rests what is laid on you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:55: God has promised those of you who believe and do righteous deeds that He will surely make you successors in the land, even as He made those who were before them successors, and that He will surely establish their religion for them that He has approved.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:56: Perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and obey the Messenger -- haply so you will find mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:57: Think not the unbelievers able to frustrate God in the earth; their refuge is the Fire -- an evil homecoming.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:58: O believers, let those your right hands own and those of you who have not reached puberty ask leave of you three times -- before the prayer of dawn, and when you put off your garments at the noon, and after the evening prayer -- three times of nakedness for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:59: When your children reach puberty, let them ask leave, as those before them asked leave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:60: Such women as are past child- bearing and have no hope of marriage -- there is no fault in them that they put off their clothes, so be it that they flaunt no ornament; but to abstain is better for them; and God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:61: There is no fault in the blind, and there is no fault in the lame, and there is no fault in the sick, neither in yourselves, that you eat of your houses, or your fathers’ houses, or your mothers’ houses, or your brothers’ houses, or your sisters’ houses, or the houses of your uncles or your aunts paternal, or the houses of your uncles or your aunts maternal, or that whereof you own the keys, or of your friend; there is no fault in you that you eat all together, or in groups separately.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:62: Those only are believers, who believe in God and His Messenger and who, when they are with him upon a common matter, go not away until they ask his leave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:63: Make not the calling of the Messenger among yourselves like your calling one of another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 24:64: Why, surely to God belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth; He ever knows what state you are upon; and the day when they shall be returned to Him, then He will tell them of what they did; and God knows everything.

Muhammad Asad.verse 24:1: A SūRAH [is this] which We have bestowed from on high, and which We have laid down in plain terms; and in it have We bestowed from on high messages which are clear [in themselves], so that you might keep
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:3: AS FOR the adulteress and the adulterer – flog each of them with a hundred stripes, and let not compassion with them keep you from [carrying out] this law of God, if you
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:4: believe in God and the Last Day; and let a group of the believers witness their chastisement.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:5: [Both are equally guilty:] the adulterer couples with none other than an adulteress – that is, a woman who accords [to her own lust] a place side by side with God; and with the adulteress couples none other than an adulterer – that is, a man who accords [to his own lust] a place side by side with God: and this is forbidden unto the believers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:6: And as for those who accuse chaste women [of adultery], and then are unable to produce four witnesses [in support of their accusation], flog them with eighty stripes; and ever after refuse to accept from them any testimony – since it is they, they that are truly depraved"
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:7: excepting [from this interdict] only those who afterwards repent and made amends: for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:8: And as for those who accuse their own wives [of adultery], but have no witnesses except themselves, let each of these
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:9: call God four times to witness that he is indeed telling the truth,
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:10: and the fifth time, that God’s curse be upon him if he is telling a lie.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:11: But [as for the wife, all] chastisement shall be averted from her by her calling God four times to witness that he is indeed telling a lie,
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:13: that God’s curse be upon her if he is telling the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:14: AND WERE it not for God’s favour upon you, [O man,] and His grace, and that God is a wise acceptor of repentance…!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:15: Verily, numerous among you are those who would falsely accuse others of unchastity: [but, O you who are thus wronged,] deem it not a bad thing for you: nay, it is good for you! [As for the slanderers,] unto every one of them [will be accounted] all that he has earned by
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:16: sinning; and awesome suffering awaits any of them who takes it upon himself to enhance this !
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:17: Why do not the believing men and women, whenever such [a rumour] is heard, think the best of one another and say, "This is an obvious falsehood"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:18: Why do they not [demand of the accusers that they] produce four witnesses to prove their allegation? – for, if they do not produce such witnesses, it is those
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:19: who, in the sight of God, are liars indeed!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:20: And were it not for God’s favour upon you, [O men,] and His grace in this world and in the life to come, awesome suffering would indeed have afflicted you in result of all [the calumny] in which you indulge
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:21: when you take it up with your tongues, uttering with your mouths something of which you have no knowledge, and deeming it a light matter whereas in the sight of God it is an awful thing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:22: And [once again]: Why do you not say, whenever you hear such [a rumour], "It does not behove us to speak of this, O Thou who art limitless in Thy glory: this is an awesome calumny"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:24: lest you ever revert to the like of this .
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:28: messages clear unto you – and God is all-knowing, wise!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:29: Verily, as for those who like [to hear] foul slander spread against [any of] those who have attained to faith – grievous suffering awaits them in this world and in the life to come: for God knows [the full truth], whereas you know
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:31: And were it not for God’s favour upon you and His grace, and that God is compassionate, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:32: O YOU who have attained to faith! Follow not Satan’s footsteps: for he who follows Satan’s footsteps [will find that], behold, he enjoins but deeds of abomination and all that runs counter to reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:33: Hence, [even if they have been wronged by slander,] let not those of you who have been graced with
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:34: favour and ease of life ever become remiss in helping [the erring ones among] their near of kin, and the needy, and those who have forsaken the domain of evil for the sake of God, but let them pardon and forbear.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:35: do you not desire that God should forgive you your sins, seeing that God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace?
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:37: verily, those who [falsely, and without repentance,] accuse chaste women who may have been unthinkingly careless but have remained true to their faith, shall be rejected [from God’s grace] in this world as well as in the life to come: and awesome suffering awaits them
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:38: on the Day when their own tongues and hands and feet will bear witness against them by
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:40: On that day will God pay them in full their just due, and they will come to know that God alone is the Ultimate Truth, manifest, and manifesting [the true nature of all that has ever been done].
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:41: [In the nature of things,] corrupt women are for corrupt men, and corrupt men, for corrupt women – just as good women are for good men, and good men, for good women.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:42: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not enter houses other than your own unless you have obtained permission and greeted their inmates.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:44: if you find no one within [the house], do not enter it until you are given leave; and if you are told, "Turn back," then turn back.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:45: [On the other hand,] you will incur no sin if you
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:46: enter houses not intended for living in but serving a purpose useful to you: but [always remember that] God knows all that you do openly, and all that you would conceal.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:47: TELL the believing men to lower their gaze and to be mindful of their chastity: this will be most conducive to their purity –
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:48: verily, God is aware of all that they do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:49: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and to be mindful of their chastity, and not to display their charms [in public] beyond what may
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:50: be apparent thereof; hence, let them draw their head-coverings over their bosoms.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:51: O you believers – all of you – turn unto God in repentance, so that you might attain to a happy state!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:52: AND [you ought to] marry the single from among you as well as such of your male and female slaves as are fit [for marriage].
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:53: And as for those who are unable to marry, let them live in continence until God grants them sufficiency out of his bounty.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:54: maidens into whoredom if they happen to be desirous of marriage; and if anyone should coerce them, then, verily, after they have been compelled [to submit in their helplessness], God will be much-forgiving.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:55: AND, INDEED, from on high have We bestowed upon you messages clearly showing the truth, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:56: a lesson from [the stories of] those who have passed away before you, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:58: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:60: like a radiant star: [a lamp] lit from a blessed tree – an olive-tree that is neither of the east nor of the west – the oil whereof [is so bright that it] would well-nigh give light [of itself] even though fire had not touched it: light upon light! God guides unto His light him that wills [to be guided]; and [to this end] God propounds parables unto men, since God
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:61: has full knowledge of all things.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:62: IN THE HOUSES [of worship] which God has allowed to be raised so that His name be remembered in them, there [are such as] extol His limitless glory at morn and evening
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:64: commerce nor striving after gain can divert from the remembrance of God, and from constancy in prayer, and from charity:
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:65: who are filled with fear [at the thought] of the Day on which all hearts and eyes will be convulsed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:66: [and who only hope] that God may reward them in accordance with the best that they ever did, and give them, out of His bounty, more [than they deserve]: for God grants sustenance unto whom He wills, beyond all reckoning.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:67: But as for those who are bent on denying the truth, their
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:68: deeds are like a mirage in the desert, which the thirsty supposes to be water – until, when he approaches it, he finds that it was nothing: instead, he finds
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:69: God [has always been present] with him, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:70: He will pay him his account in full – for God is swift in reckoning!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:71: Or [else, their deeds are] like the depths of darkness upon an abysmal sea, made yet more dark by wave billowing over wave, with
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:72: clouds above it all: depths of darkness, layer upon layer, [so that] when one holds up his hand, he can hardly see it: for he to whom God gives no light, no light whatever has he!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:73: ART THOU NOT aware that it is God whose limitless glory all
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:74: that are in the heavens and on earth extol, even the birds as they spread out their wings? Each [of them] knows indeed how to pray unto Him and to glorify Him; and God has full knowledge of all that they do:
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:75: for God’s is the dominion over the heavens and the earth, and with God is all journeys’ end.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:76: Art thou not aware that it is God who causes the clouds to move onward, then joins them together, then piles them up in masses, until thou canst see rain come forth from their midst? And He it is who sends down from the skies, by degrees, mountainous masses [of clouds] charged with hail, striking therewith whomever He wills and averting it from whomever He wills, [the while] the flash of His lightning well-nigh deprives [men of their] sight!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:77: It is God who causes night and day to alternate: in this ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:78: behold, there is surely a lesson for all who have eyes to see!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:79: And it is God who has created all animals out of water; and [He has willed that] among them are such as crawl on their bellies, and such as walk on two legs, and such as walk on four.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:80: INDEED, from on high have We bestowed messages clearly showing the truth; but God guides onto a straight way

Muhammad Asad.verse 24:84: and these are by no means
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:86: And [so it is that] whenever they are summoned unto God and His Apostle in order that [the divine writ] might judge between them, lo! some of them turn away;
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:87: but if the truth happens to be to their liking, they are quite willing to accept it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:88: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they begun to doubt [that this is a divine writ]? Or do they fear that God and His Apostle might deal unjustly with them? Nay, it is
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:89: they, they who are doing wrong [to themselves]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:90: The only response of believers, whenever they are summoned unto God and His Apostle in order that [the divine writ] might judge between them, can be no other than, "We have heard, and we pay heed!" – and it is they, they who shall attain to a happy state:
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:91: for they who pay heed unto God and His Apostle, and stand in awe of God and are conscious of Him, it is they, they who shall triumph [in the end]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:92: Now [as for those half-hearted ones,] they do swear by God with their most solemn oaths that if thou [O Apostle] shouldst ever bid them to do so, they would most certainly go forth [and sacrifice themselves].
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:93: Say: "Pay heed unto God, and pay heed unto the Apostle.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:94: God has promised those of you who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds that, of a certainty, He will cause them to accede to power on earth, even as He caused [some of] those who lived before them to accede to it; and that, of a certainty, He will firmly establish for them the religion which He has been pleased to bestow on them; and that, of a certainty, He will cause their erstwhile state of fear to be replaced by a sense of security – [seeing that] they worship Me ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:95: not ascribing divine powers to aught beside Me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:96: Hence, [O believers,] be constant in prayer, and render the purifying dues, and pay heed unto the Apostle, so that you might be graced with God’s mercy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:98: think not that those who are bent on denying the truth can elude [their final reckoning even if they remain unscathed] on earth: the fire is their goal [in the life to come] – and vile indeed is such a journey’s end!
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:99: O YOU who have attained to faith! At three times [of day], let
Muhammad Asad.verse 24:100: those whom you rightfully possess, as well as those from among you who have not yet attained to puberty, ask leave of you [before intruding upon your privacy]: before the prayer of daybreak, and whenever you lay aside your garments in the middle of the day, and after the prayer of nightfall: the three occasions on which your nakedness is likely to be bared.

Muhammad Asad.verse 24:102: about you, attending to [the needs of] one another.

Muhammad Asad.verse 24:104: AND [know that] women advanced in years, who no longer feel any sexual desire, incur no sin if they discard their

Muhammad Asad.verse 24:109: the keys whereof are in your charge, or [the house] of any of your friends; nor will you incur any sin by eating in company or separately.

Muhammad Asad.verse 24:118: Oh, verily, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: well does He know where you stand and at what you aim! And one Day, all [who have ever lived] will be brought back unto Him, and then He will make them

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:1: This is a Sūrah We have sent down and enjoined, and sent down in it clear signs, so that you may receive the advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:2: The fornicating woman and the fornicating man, flog each one of them with one hundred stripes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:3: A man who is fornicator does not (like to) marry but a woman who is a fornicator or a polytheist; and a woman who is a fornicator does not (like to) marry but a man who is a fornicator or a polytheist.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:4: Those who accuse the chaste women (of fornication), but they do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty stripes and do not accept their any evidence any more.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:5: except those who repent afterwards and mend their ways; then, Allah is All-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:6: Those who accuse their wives (of adultery) while they have no witnesses except their own selves, then the evidence of one of them would be to swear four oaths by Allah that he is truthful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:7: and the fifth (oath) that Allah’s curse be on him if he is one of the liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:8: And it will remove the punishment from the woman if she swears four oaths by Allah that he (the accuser husband) is certainly one of the liars,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:9: and the fifth (oath) that Allah’s wrath be on her if he is one of the truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:10: Had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy, and (had it not been) that Allah is Most-Relenting, All-Wise, (you would have faced severe hardships).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:11: Those who have come up with the false imputation are a gang among you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:12: Why - when you (O believers) heard of it - did the believing men and the believing women not think well about their own selves, and (why did they not) say, “This is a manifest lie”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:13: Why did they (the accusers) not bring four witnesses to prove this? So, as they did not bring the witnesses, they are the liars in the sight of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:14: Had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy in this world and in the Hereafter, a severe punishment would have reached you for what you indulged in -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:15: when you were welcoming it with your tongues, and were saying with your mouths something of which you had no knowledge, and were taking it as a trivial matter, while in the sight of Allah it was grave.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:16: And why, when you heard of it, did you not say, “It is not for us to speak about this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:17: Allah admonishes you never to repeat something like this, if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:18: Allah makes the signs clear to you, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:19: Surely, those who like that lewdness spreads among the believers, for them there is painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:20: Had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy, and that Allah is Very-Kind, Very-Merciful (you would have been destroyed).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:21: O you who believe, do not follow the footsteps of Satan.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:22: The men of grace and wealth among you should not swear against giving (their charitable gifts) to the kinsmen and the poor and to those who have migrated in the way of Allah, and they should forgive and forego.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:23: Surely, those who level a false charge against the chaste, natve and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there is a mighty punishment
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:24: on the Day when their tongues, their hands and their legs will testify against themselves of what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:25: On that day Allah will give them their rightful recompense in full, and they will know that Allah is the Very Truth who makes all things manifest.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:26: Vile women are for vile men, and vile men are for vile women; and good women are for good men, and good men are for good women.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:27: O you who believe, do not enter any houses, other than your own houses unless you seek permission and greet their inmates with Salām .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:28: Even if you do not find anyone in them, do not enter therein until permission is given to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:29: There is no sin on you if you enter uninhabited houses in which you have rightful benefit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:30: Tell the believing men that they must lower their gazes and guard their private parts; it is more decent for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:31: And tell the believing women that they must lower their gazes and guard their private parts, and must not expose their adornment, except that which appears thereof, and must wrap their bosoms with their shawls, and must not expose their adornment, except to their husbands or their fathers or the fathers of their husbands, or to their sons or the sons of their husbands, or to their brothers or the sons of their brothers or the sons of their sisters, or to their women, or to those owned by their right hands, or male attendants having no (sexual) urge, or to the children who are not yet conscious of the shames of women.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:32: Arrange the marriage of the spouseless among you, and the capable from among your bondmen and bondwomen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:33: And those who cannot afford marriage should keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them out of His grace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:34: Indeed We have sent down to you enlightening verses, and an exemplary description of those who passed away before you, and a good counsel for the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:35: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:36: (The guided people worship Allah) in the houses that Allah has permitted to be raised, and where His name is recounted and His purity is pronounced, in the morning and in the evening,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:37: by the men whom no trade or sale makes neglectful of the remembrance of Allah, nor from establishing Salāh and paying Zakāh ; they are fearful of a day in which the hearts and the eyes will be over-turned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:38: The fate (of such people) is that Allah will reward them for the best deeds they did, and will give them more out of His grace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:39: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert plain, which a thirsty person deems to be water, until when he comes to it, he finds it nothing, and finds (the decree of) Allah with him, so He pays him his account in full.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:40: Or (their deeds) are like layers of darkness in a vast deep sea overwhelmed by a wave, above which there is another wave, above which there are clouds - layers of darkness, one above the other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:41: Did you not realize that purity of Allah is proclaimed by all those in the heavens and the earth, and by the birds with their wings spread out? Everyone knows one’s own (way of) praying (to Allah) and one’s own (way of) proclaiming Allah’s purity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:42: To Allah belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and towards Allah is the final return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:43: Do you not realize that Allah drives the clouds, then joins them together, then turns them into a heap? Then you see the rain coming out from their midst.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:44: Allah alternates the night and the day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:45: Allah has created every moving creature from water.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:46: We have surely sent down enlightening verses, and Allah guides whom He wills to the straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:47: They say, “We have believed in Allah and in the messenger, and have adopted obedience”, then a group from them goes back after all this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:48: When they are summoned to Allah and His messenger that he (the messenger) may judge between them, in no time a group of them turns averse.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:49: And if the right is theirs, they would come to him as (if they are) submissive ones.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:50: Is there a malady in their hearts or do they have doubt or do they fear that Allah and His messenger will do injustice to them? Rather they themselves are the unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:51: The only reply of the (true) believers, when they are summoned to Allah and His messenger that he (the messenger) may judge between them, is that they say, “We listen and obey.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:52: Whoever obeys Allah and His messenger and has awe of Him and observes Taqwā for His sake, then such people are the victorious.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:53: And they (the hypocrites) swear by Allah on forceful oaths that if you (O prophet) order them, they will certainly leave (their homes for Jihād ).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:54: Say, “Obey Allah and obey the messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:55: Allah has promised those of you who believe and do good deeds that He will certainly make them (His) vicegerents in the land, as He made those before them, and will certainly establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and will certainly give them peace in place of fear in which they were before; (provided that) they worship Me, ascribing no partner to Me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:56: Establish Salāh and pay Zakāh and obey the messenger, so that you may be favored with mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:57: Never think that the disbelievers are (able) to frustrate (Allah’s plan) on the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:58: O you who believe, the slaves owned by you, and those of you who have not reached puberty, must seek your permission (to see you) at three times: before the prayer of Fajr, and when you take off your clothes at noon, and after the prayer of ‘Ishā’.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:59: When the children from among you reach puberty, they must seek permission, as the permission is sought by those before them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:60: And those old women who have no hope for marriage, there is no sin on them, if they take off their (extra) clothes while they do not display their adornment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:61: There is no blame on a blind person, nor is there any blame on any lame one, nor is there any blame on a sick person, nor on yourselves in that you eat (something) from your own homes or from the homes of your fathers or the homes of your mothers or the homes of your brothers or the homes of your sisters or the homes of your paternal uncles, or the homes of your paternal aunts or the homes of your maternal uncles or the homes of your maternal aunts or from the places the keys of which you have under your control,16 or from (the home of) your friend.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:62: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His messenger and who, when they are with him for a collective matter, do not leave unless they seek his permission.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:63: Do not take the call of the messenger among you as a call of one of you to another.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 24:64: Remember! To Allah belongs all that is there in the heavens and the earth.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:1: A sūra which We have revealed and prescribed and wherein We have revealed manifest signs that perhaps you might remember.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:2: As for the fornicatress and the fornicator, strike each of them a hundred lashes.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:3: The fornicator shall not marry anyone but a fornicatress or an idolatress, and the fornicatress shall be married by none except a fornicator or an idolator, and that is forbidden to believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:4: And those who accuse honourable women [in wedlock], and then do not bring four witnesses, strike them eighty lashes, and do not accept any testimony from them ever; and those, they are the immoral,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:5: except those who repent thereafter and make amends, for God is indeed Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:6: And those who accuse their wives, but have no witnesses, except themselves, then the testimony of one of them shall be to testify
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:7: by God four times that he is indeed being truthful,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:8: and a fifth time that God's wrath shall be upon him if he were lying.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:9: And the punishment shall be averted from her if she testify
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:10: by God four times that he is indeed lying,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:11: and a fifth time that God's wrath shall be upon her if he were being truthful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:12: And were it not for God's bounty to you and His mercy, and that God is the Relenting, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:13: Truly those who initiated the slander are a band from among yourselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:15: heard about it, did the believing men and women not think good of themselves, and say, 'This is a manifest calumny?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:16: Why did they not produce four witnesses to it? And since they did not produce the witnesses, those, in God's sight, they are liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:17: And were it not for God's bounty to you and His mercy in the life of this world and the Hereafter there would have befallen you, for what you engaged in, an awful chastisement,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:19: with your tongues, and were uttering with your mouths that whereof you had no knowledge, supposing it to be a light matter, while with God it was grave.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:20: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, 'It is not for us to speak about this.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:21: God admonishes you, lest you should ever repeat the like of it, if you are [in truth] believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:22: And God clarifies for you the signs, and God is Knower, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:23: Truly those who love that indecency should be spread, concerning those who believe, theirs will be a painful chastisement in the life of this world and the Hereafter, and God knows, and you do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:24: And were it not for God's bounty to you, and His mercy and that God is Gentle, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:25: O you who believe, do not follow in the steps of Satan.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:26: And do not let those of you who possess bounty and the affluent swear not to give to the near of kin and the poor and those who emigrate in the way of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:27: Truly those who make accusations against honourably married women who are unaware and who believe, shall be cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and there will be an awful chastisement for them
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:28: on the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet shall testify against them concerning what they used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:29: On that day God will pay them in full their just due, and they shall know that God is the Manifest Truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:30: Vile women are for vile men, and vile men for vile women.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:31: O you who believe, do not enter houses other than your houses until you have
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:32: asked permission and greeted their occupants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:33: And if you do not find anyone in them,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:34: do not enter them until permission has been given to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:35: You would not be at fault if you enter [without permission] uninhabited houses wherein is comfort for you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:36: Tell believing men to lower their gaze and to guard their private parts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:37: And tell believing women to lower their gaze and to guard their private parts, and not to display their adornment except for what is apparent, and let them draw their veils over their bosoms and not reveal their adornment, except to their husbands or their fathers, or their husbands' fathers, or their sons, or their husbands' sons, or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their women, or what their right hands own, or such men who are dependant, not possessing any sexual desire, or children who are not yet aware of women's private parts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:38: And marry off the spouseless among you and the righteous ones among your male slaves and your female slaves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:39: And let those who cannot find the means to marry be continent, until God enriches them out of His bounty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:40: And verily We have revealed to you clear verses and an example of those who passed away before you, and an admonition for those who fear God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:41: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:42: In houses [whose status] God has allowed to be raised, and wherein His Name is remembered, therein
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:43: make glorifications to Him in the mornings and the evenings,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:44: men whom neither trading, nor sale distracts from the remembrance of God and the observance of prayer and payment of the alms.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:45: so that God may reward them for the best of what they did, and give them more out of His bounty; and God provides whomever He will without
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:47: And as for those who disbelieve, their works are like a mirage in a plain which the thirsty man supposes to be water until he comes to it and finds it to be nothing, and he finds God there, Who pays him his account in full; and God is swift at reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:48: Or as the manifold darkness on a deep sea, covered by a billow, above which there is
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:49: billow, above which there are clouds, manifold [layers of] darkness, one on top of another.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:50: Have you not seen that God is glorified by all who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds spreading their wings? Of each [one of them] He verily knows its prayer and its glorification; and God knows what they do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:51: And to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and with God is the journey's end.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:52: Have you not seen how God drives the clouds, then composes them, then piles them up, whereat you see the rain issuing from the midst of them? And He sends down from the heaven out of the mountains that are therein hail, and smites with it whom He will and turns it away from whom He will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:53: God alternates the night and the day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:54: And God has created every beast from fluid.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:55: And verily We have revealed manifest signs, and God guides whomever He will to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:56: And they say, 'We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:57: And when they are summoned to God and His Messenger, that he may judge between them, behold, a party of them are averse.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:58: But if right be on their side they would come to him willingly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:59: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or are they in doubt, or do they fear that God and His Messenger will be unjust to them? Rather, those, they are the wrongdoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:60: All that the believers say, when they are summoned to God and His Messenger, that he may judge between them, is that they say, 'We hear and we obey'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:61: And he who obeys God and His Messenger, and fears God and fears Him, those, they are the winners.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:62: And they swear by God solemn oaths that if you order them, they will surely go forth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:63: Say: 'Obey God, and obey the Messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:65: God has promised those of you who believe and perform righteous deeds that He will surely make them successors in the earth, just as He made those who were before them successors, and He will surely establish for them their religion which He has approved for them, and that He will give them in exchange after their fear security.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:66: And establish prayer and pay the alms, and obey the Messenger, that perhaps you may find mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:67: And do not suppose that those who disbelieve can escape in the land.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:68: O you who believe, let those whom your right hands own, and those of you who have not reached puberty, ask leave of you three times: before the dawn prayer, and when you put off your garments at noon, and after the night prayer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:71: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them seek permission, just as those sought permission before them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:72: And as for menopausal women who do not expect to marry, they would not be at fault if they put off their clothes in such a way as not to display adornment; but to refrain [from doing so] is better for them; and God is Hearer, Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:73: There is no blame upon the blind, nor any blame upon the lame, nor any blame upon the sick, nor upon yourselves if you eat from your own houses, or your fathers' houses, or your mothers' houses, or your brothers' houses, or your sisters' houses, or the houses of your paternal uncles or the houses of your paternal aunts, or the houses of your maternal uncles or the houses of your maternal aunts, or
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:74: that whereof you hold the keys, or
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:77: Only they are believers who believe in God and His Messenger and who, when they are with him in a collective affair do not leave until they have asked leave of him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:78: Do not, among yourselves, consider the calling of the Messenger to be like your calling of one another.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 24:79: Lo! surely to God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:1: This is a (great) Sura (chapter) which We have revealed and We have made its (commandments) obligatory.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:2: Whip a hundred lashes each, the (unmarried) adulteress and the adulterer (on validation of adultery in accordance with the conditions of the statutory
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:4: An adulterer does not (like to) marry (a chaste and virtuous woman) but only an adulteress or a polytheist, and no (pious man likes to) marry an adulteress (too) but only an adulterer or a polytheist.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:5: And those who accuse chaste women (of adultery), then fail to produce four witnesses, whip them eighty lashes (as qadhaf—the punishment for false accusation of adultery) and never accept their evidence.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:6: Except for those who repent after this (false blaming) and mend their ways.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:7: And those who accuse their wives (of adultery) and have no witnesses except themselves, the testimony of such a person is to swear (himself) four times by Allah that he is truthful (in his accusation),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:8: And the fifth time (to say) that Allah’s curse be upon him if he is a liar.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:9: And (similarly) this can avert punishment from that (woman too) if she (herself) gives evidence, swearing four times by Allah that he (the husband) is a liar (in accusing her),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:10: And the fifth time (to say) that Allah’s wrath be upon her if he (the husband) is truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:11: And had there not been Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, (then you would have been more perturbed under such circumstances) and Allah is surely Most Relenting, All-Wise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:12: Surely those who fabricated the accusation (against ‘A’isha the truthful, the pure, the chaste—may Allah be well pleased with her) were (also) a party from amongst you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:13: Why did it not happen that when you heard of it (the slander), the believers, both men and women, would think good of their own people and say: ‘This is obviously a fabricated accusation (based on falsehood)’?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:14: Why did these (slanderers) not produce four witnesses to this (turmoil)? Since they could not bring forth witnesses, it is certainly they who are liars in the sight of Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:15: And had there not been Allah’s grace upon you and His mercy in this world and in the Hereafter, severe torment would have afflicted you for promoting that (slander) into which you rushed headlong.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:16: When (hearing this matter from one another) you brought it on your tongues, and uttered with your mouths something about which you (yourselves) had no knowledge, and you took (the propagation of) this matter as inconsiderable, whereas in the presence of Allah it was a grave (offence underway).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 24:17: And when you heard of this (heinous charge), why did you not declare (at the same moment): ‘It is not (at all justified) for us to talk about it’?
